intro: Rapuntium breynii, commonly known as the Arctic bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of northern Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cold, harsh environments. It has hairy, narrow leaves and produces small, edible tubers that are sometimes used in traditional cuisine. Rapuntium breynii is a hardy species adapted to low temperatures and short growing seasons.
